title: Yevgania Yosifovna Yakhina
text:
Soviet composer Yevgania Yosifovna Yakhina (1918 – 1983) was born in <a href="Kharkiv">Kharkiv</a> (today part of Ukraine). She studied composition under <a href="Vissarion%20Shebalin">Vissarion Shebalin</a> at the <a href="Moscow%20Conservatory">Moscow Conservatory</a>, graduating in 1945. She taught at the Moscow School of Music from 1944 to 1948, then taught evening classes at an unspecified school beginning in 1953. Yakhina set poems by <a href="Alexander%20Blok">Alexander Blok</a>, <a href="Vadim%20Shefner">Vadim Shefner</a>, and other Soviet poets, to music.
Her compositions include:
Vocal.
References
